Description: Rhodian pottery transport amphora handle, now completely disintegrated into numerous slivers; shape cannot be reconstructed, but judging from the fragments there seems to have been a fairly sharp bend in the handle. Finely porous clay with a fair amount of very small mica and small lime (? - white) inclusions, some sand(?). Of the stamp only a small portion can be reconstructed - a round stamp with rose symbol and traces of the surrounding text. Slight remains of the stamp on two other fragments, on on something that looks like a tiny sigma next to two bumps.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by McLean Museum and Art Gallery, Greenock. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Given by the Egypt Exploration Fund, March 1888
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1235)
